text: hi everyone is Helen here today I will
be making steamed banana cake it's
called monkey hub in Vietnamese this
banana is the more common food in
Vietnam we have created many dishes from
it light make it banana cake banana ice
cream banana pudding fried banana and
today we are making steamed banana cake
it's very delicious and it's a circle of
generous amount corner topping so it's
very rich and just play before so I hope
you like this one and let's begin
I'm using one package of 500 gram Asian
bananas peeled and frozen we can buy
this a station store if not you can use
around 6 no more Western bananas cut
into half inch slices then marinate with
route 3 to 4 tbsp of sugar depending on
the sweetness of the bananas mix well
until the banana slices are well coated
with sugar then set aside for about 15
minutes
after around 15 minutes or half an hour
the banana slices look like they are
sweating that's good now add in 1 and
1/2 cup double yolk a starch and mix
well then add in half a cup water around
hundred 20 ml and also the store well
the mixture looks really thick but
that's okay just continue mixing until
it's all combined like this oh no I
forgot to add the food coloring well
better late than never
I add in a few drops of yellow food
coloring now actually you should add the
yellow food coloring before you add in
the tapioca starch so that the banana
has a nicer yellow color because I add
it now so the whole cake gonna be yellow
and not just the banana now light them
all with some food plastic wrap so that
is easier to remove later because I'm
using silicone bands so I don't need to
do that transfer the mixture into the
mold you can arrange some banana slices
nicely and the bottom and on the surface
of the cake so it look nicer then we're
gonna steam the cake for 20 minutes and
it's done remember to wrap and tie the
lid of the steamer with a kitchen towel
to avoid water from dripping into the
cake voila now that's thin banana cake
is done but it's not ready to eat now
you have to let it cool completely be
patient and wait while is 2 to 3 hours
until the cake is completely cool and
set you may want to grease the knife and
the plate with some vegetable oil to
avoid sticking then remove the cake from
the mold
crease the knife with vegetable oil in
between every cut that will help you to
have nicer slices
normally Vietnam they cut into diamond
shape
look how beautiful and delicious buddies
now transfer to a serving plate and
drizzle a generous amount of coconut
sauce on top you can click on the
picture to know how I make this coconut
sauce finally sprinkle rose the cross
peanut and sesame on top
the cake is slightly crunchy and chewy
and the coconut sauce and crushed
peanuts and seasoned may make a perfect
combination it's just a dream for
dessert lovers if you would like to
watch more Asian visit recipes you can
go to my channel or visit 110 million
channels she has many great recipes or
Asian desserts and Chinese dishes there
I hope you enjoy and thank you for
watching bye
